SEARCH
Package academy.mindswap.game

Class ConnectFourBoard

java.lang.Object
academy.mindswap.game.ConnectFourBoard
public class ConnectFourBoard extends Object
Class responsible for creating a board of the game and saves the board positions. Invoking the connectFourBoard will create a matrix 7x6. Contains methods to place pieces on the board. Checks for a winner or a draw and keeps updating the board for display.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectFourBoard

      public ConnectFourBoard()

  • Method Details

    • fillEmptyBoard

      public void fillEmptyBoard()
      Fills the real board with ⬤ which represents an empty position.

    • placePiece

      public void placePiece(String move, int playerChoiceInput)
      Method to place a piece "R" or "Y" into the real board. Also invokes the method that updates the display board. Increments the number of plays tha has already been made.
      Parameters:
      move - the current player piece "R"/"Y";
      playerChoiceInput - the column selected by the player

    • checkFullColumn

      public boolean checkFullColumn(int playerChoiceInput)
      Checks if the column selected by the player is already full.
      Parameters:
      playerChoiceInput - the column selected by the player.
      Returns:
      returns true if the column is already full or false if it still has any space left.

    • updatePrettyBoard

      public String updatePrettyBoard()
      Method creates a String representation of the board that is displayed to the player. This is not the real board. Transforms the real board to a display and prettier one. and replaces the "Y" with a Yellow ⬤, the "R" with a Red ⬤ and "W" with a Green ⬤. Creates a visual board with colored circles.
      Returns:
      returns the display board to be displayed to the players.

    • checkDraw

      public boolean checkDraw()
      Checks if the game ended as draw. A draw is when the max number of moves is played (42) and neither player won.
      Returns:
      true if it's a draw and false if not.

    • checkWinner

      public boolean checkWinner(String playerTurn)
      Checks if a winner was found right after the player places a piece.
      Parameters:
      playerTurn - the piece of the player who just played (Y/R).
      Returns:
      true if it has a winner (4 pieces of the same colour connected in any direction) or false if no winner was found.

    • getPrettyBoard

      public String getPrettyBoard()

    • resetNumberOfPlays

      public void resetNumberOfPlays()
